contentrichtext.text: [[File:Eberhard Schrader.jpg|thumb|Eberhard Schrader, about the 1880s]] '''Eberhard Schrader''' (January 7, 1836 – July 4, 1908), was a [[Germany|German]] [[oriental studies|orientalist]] primarily known for his achievements in [[Assyriology]]. ==Biography== He was born at [[Braunschweig (city)|Braunschweig]], and educated at [[university of Göttingen|Göttingen]] under [[Georg Heinrich August Ewald|Ewald]]. In 1858 he won a university prize for a treatise on the [[Ethiopia]]n languages, and in 1863 became professor of [[theology]] at the [[University of Zürich]]. Subsequently he occupied chairs at [[University of Giessen|Giessen]] (1870) and [[University of Jena|Jena]] (1873), and finally became professor of Oriental languages at the [[Humboldt University of Berlin|Friedrich Wilhelm University]], [[Berlin]] in 1878. Though he turned first to biblical research, his chief achievements were in the field of [[Assyriology]], in which he was a pioneer in Germany and acquired an international reputation. He died in [[Berlin]]. ==Works== His publications include: *''Studien zur Kritik und Erklärung der biblischen Urgeschichte'' (1863) *[[Wilhelm Martin Leberecht de Wette]]'s ''Einleitung in das Alte Testament'', 8th edition (1869) *''Die assyr.-babyl. Keilinschriften'' (1872) *''Die Keilinschriften und das Alt. Test.'' (1872; 3rd ed. by Zimmern and Winckler, 1901-1902) *''Keilinschriften und Geschichtsforschung'' (1878) *''Die Höllenfahrt der Istar'' (text, trans., notes, 1874) *''Zur Frage nach dem Ursprung der altbabylonischen Kultur'' (1884) *''Keilinschriftliche Bibliothek'', in conjunction with other scholars (1877). ==References== * {{Cite EB1911|Schrader, Eberhard}} {{Authority control|VIAF=3237549}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Schrader, Eberhard | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = German orientalist | DATE OF BIRTH = January 7, 1836 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = July 4, 1908 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Schrader, Eberhard}} [[Category:1836 births]] [[Category:1908 deaths]] [[Category:German theologians]] [[Category:German Assyriologists]] [[Category:People from Braunschweig]] [[Category:People from Brunswick]]
